lines: My first internship experience was with a hedge fund in New York City.
Almost all of the firm’s software was built in-house by a team of about 8 engineers.
User facing software was written primarily in C#.
These applications relied heavily upon large SQL databases maintained by the firm.
Most of my work was in optimization.
In the beginning of the summer, I worked exclusively on a nightly process which parsed emails containing financial data.
The process became exponentially slower as email volumes increased.
I parallelized the process and eliminated unnecessary calculations.
When run on the firm’s 18-core server, my edits resulted in a 45x speedup!
My other contributions often dealt with improving UI performance for the traders.
I achieved this using C#’s relatively new async/await features.
I enjoyed learning about the backend software which makes UIs performant and responsive.
By the end of the summer, I made good friends with my teammates and greatly improved my SQL and C# skills!
